summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from March to July 2019 regarding travel approval requests for federal agents and an Assistant U.S. Attorney to conduct victim interviews and meetings in Florida and Los Angeles as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). The emails show coordination for travel logistics, including hotel conference room reservations.

connections.description: Work together as part of the investigation team traveling to conduct victim interviews for the Epstein case.

events.title: Travel for Florida victim interviews
events.description: Agents plan to travel to Palm Beach, Florida starting the day after the email (July 10) through Sunday for victim interviews, with some team members arriving Thursday.

events.title: Travel for Los Angeles victim interview
events.description: Investigation team requested permission to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview, tentatively flying Wednesday and returning by Friday.

events.title: Travel for Florida meetings and interviews
events.description: Team requested permission to travel for approximately three days to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and victim interviews, planning to fly Tuesday night and return Wednesday or Thursday.

events.title: Travel for Florida meetings and interviews
events.description: Team requested permission to travel for approximately three days to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation, planning to fly Tuesday night and return Friday.

events.title: Initial travel for Florida meetings
events.description: Initial travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation, planning to fly Wednesday night and return Saturday.

keyFacts: The investigation is officially titled 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618' and relates to 'enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Federal agents and an AUSA were actively conducting victim interviews in multiple cities (Florida and Los Angeles) between March and July 2019.
Travel requests consistently included permission to reserve hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing investigative activity months before Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
The correspondence shows standard government travel approval procedures being used for a high-profile investigation.
